title: How Husky fans can support UW Athletics with a phone plan
description: Husky Mobile, a phone plan in which payments result in "automatic contribution to UW athletics, scholarship or student funds," was launched Wednesday.
content:
Husky Mobile, a phone plan in which each monthly payment results in an “automatic contribution to UW Athletics, scholarship or student funds,” was launched Wednesday, the University of Washington announced in a news release.

Husky Mobile is a collaboration between UW, T-Mobile, Collegiate Mobile, and sports marketing firm Learfield. In addition to automatic payments to the university, Husky Mobile customers will also get game-day perks, including a fast pass to skip lines and seat upgrades.

“We are excited to launch this innovative, industry-first mobile partnership with Collegiate Mobile, powered by T-Mobile,” said UW athletic director Pat Chun in the news release. “This new product provides Husky fans another meaningful way to support UW Athletics, while partnering with a globally recognized brand that is rooted right here in our community. We look forward to seeing this partnership continue to expand.”

Phone plans range from $15 to $45 per month, with UW getting $3.15 a month on the $45 plan.

Customers can decide whether their contributions go to UW athletics, the UW Scholarship Fund or the UW Student Fund.
summary: The University of Washington (U.S. has launched a mobile phone plan, Husky Mobile, that includes an automatic contribution to the university and offers game-day perks such as a fast pass to skip lines and seat upgrades. The plan is a collaboration between U.S., T-Mobile, and sports marketing firm Learfield. The cost of the plan is between $15 and $45 per month.
shortSummary: Husky Mobile, a mobile phone plan offering automatic contributions to UW Athletics, offers game-day perks and flexibility, partnering with T-Mobile to enhance user satisfaction.
argos_summary: The University of Washington has launched Husky Mobile, a phone plan that automatically contributes to UW Athletics, scholarships, or student funds. The partnership involves T-Mobile, Collegiate Mobile, and Learfield, offering game-day perks such as fast passes and seat upgrades. Plans range from $15 to $45 per month, with $3.15 from the $45 plan going to the university. Customers can choose which UW fund their contributions support.
